column2: NEW JERSEY DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 2. If your car goes into water, you should:
column6: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column8: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

column2: 3. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column6: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 4. Regulation signs normally are:
5. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column6: turning right on red is forbidden.
column8: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.

column2: 6. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column6: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 7. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column10: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 8. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
9. This sign indicates that:
column4: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column6: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column8: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column10: there is a school zone after the curve.

column2: 10. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column8: before the traffic light turns red.

column2: 11. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column6: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 12. What does this sign indicate?
13. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: follow the vehicle ahead of you.
column6: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column8: stop, look left, then right, then left again.
column10: stop, look right, then left, then right again.

column2: 14. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column6: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column8: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column10: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.

column2: 15. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column8: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

column2: 16. What does this sign indicate?
column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column10: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 17. Regulatory signs are:
18. This road sign means:
column6: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
20. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column6: number of cars in front of you.
column8: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.

column2: 21. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.
22. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column6: As far to the right as possible.
column8: As close as possible to the center line.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 24. Your BAC depends on:
column8: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
26. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
27. What do warning signs mean?
column6: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column8: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.

column2: 28. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column6: You must pass the school bus.
column8: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column10: The bus is about to stop.

column2: 29. Bicyclists must:
column4: remain near the left edge of the road.
column6: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column8: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column10: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.

column2: 30. If you begin to feel drowsy while driving, you should:
31. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: go to the next entrance ramp.

column2: 32. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: go through as soon as the first train passes.
column6: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column8: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.
column10: go through when one of the tracks is free.

column2: 33. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
34. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the type of beverage you drink.
column6: the amount of alcohol you drink.

column2: 35. If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
36. This road sign means:
37. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column6: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit
column8: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05
column10: Even the smallest amount of alcohol

column2: 38. This road sign means:
39. This road sign means:
40. This road sign means:
column6: You must come to a complete stop
column10: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way

column2: 41. The yield sign means:
column4: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column6: You must come to a complete stop.
column8: The traffic light will soon be red.
column10: Drive with caution in wet weather.

column2: 42. This sign warns that:
column4: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 43. ABS is the acronym for:
44. Before backing up, you should:
column4: turn your head and look through the rear window.
column8: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.
column10: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.

column2: 45. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column8: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 46. This road sign means:
column4: Pass only in the right lane
column8: Cars in right lane must slow down

column2: 47. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column6: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column8: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 48. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
49. This sign indicates:
column6: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column10: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.

column2: 50. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column10: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
